initial_story:
The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on X, formerly known as Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.
stories:
The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on X, formerly known as Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The pilot and crew were able to get out safely and were treated for minor injuries.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on X, formerly known as Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The pilot and crew were able to get out safely and were treated for minor injuries.

But, they were not out of the woods yet. The storm had not finished with them.

As they were making their way back to the helicopter, they were hit by a sudden gust of wind. It sent them flying through the air, crashing into a nearby tree.

The impact knocked them unconscious. When they woke up, they found themselves in a hospital bed. They had been in a coma for three days.

They were told that they had suffered serious injuries and would never be able to fly again.

The pilot and crew were devastated. They had always dreamed of being pilots, and now their dreams were shattered.

But, they were not the only ones who were affected by the storm. The storm had also caused extensive damage to the city.

Many buildings had been damaged, and there was a lot of debris on the streets. The city was in chaos.

The police and emergency services were working around the clock to try to restore order.

But, they were having a hard time. The storm had caused a lot of damage, and there was a lot of work to be done.

The people of the city were scared and worried. They didn't know what was going to happen next.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on X, formerly known as Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.

The wind was so strong it actually made the helicopter fly sideways, causing it to crash into the side of a building.
